rounds.passage:
The gallery atrium stood empty but for the slow whir of the ceiling fans. Sunlight fell in tall blocks across the marble, leaving a pale seam between the benches. She pictured visitors drifting in and out, each step a quiet metronome that kept the building calm.

Along the far wall, brochures waited in perfect stacks beside a copper planter. A single fern leaned toward the doorway, its fronds mirrored in the glass case opposite it. She tested how the space would feel if that planter slid a little left, if one bench edged forward and broke the line.

By the service desk, she kept a notebook of every adjustment she had tried. Small shifts in distance changed the atmosphere by degrees. Some arrangements cooled the room into absolute stillness; others tipped just enough to charge the air.
rounds.design_note: Calm settles at the center; a lean either way stirs energy.
